title: The New Player Experience @GhostCrawler

embed.description: Album with topic of No Topic uploaded by SirPrizeWinner. Cmon

body:
This account is level 23, decent win rate, and I've picked fill. It's now 20 minutes into the queue as I'm writing this.

There are barely any new players compared to when I started. I get matched with the same people over and over, and those same people are INCREDIBLY toxic, calling new people "boosted shits" and "useless fucks go kill yourselves". This is in level 15-25 games. I made a new account to see how far I could get as a OTP, and this has reminded me of how painful the new player experience is when starting out and why so many of my friends have never made it to level 30, which is where the ACTUAL game barely even starts.

You are at a disadvantage before the game even starts if your opponents are high leveled than you even 1 more level, that means more mastery points and runes. 

Anybody who is matched against someone level 18 or up when they are 17 or lower almost always loses lane because of keystones.

There is a majority of smurfs and banned players with new accounts just being absolutely abusive to anyone and everyone they are matched with. I know this from other friends who are brand new who dont have the matchmaking adjustments I do because of my match history on my account.

This is horrendous, and this is why this game can't succeed without you completely redoing one of the most important parts of the game. Starting out. This is currently like deciding to play american football at age 14, being thrown onto 1 of 2 teams with players aged 10-18, and saying "good luck have fun". It just doesnt work.

Edit: Took me 25 minutes total to get in a lobby and start a game. The population of "new" players is smaller than plat. That says something.

replies.body:
A few things:

1) We'll look into queue times for sub 30 accounts. We have changed the matchmaking system a lot lately to solve long queue times at various MMRs and it's possible a recent change adversely affected low level queues.

2) We are also talking about whether both blind and draft are needed for sub 30 accounts.

3) All that being said, the issue for your queue times specifically is probably because your MMR is really high for a low-level account (so gratz?) and the matchmaker is doing its job by trying to find very high MMR but sub 30 accounts to play against. It's also unsurprising then that you're running into a lot of smurfs, since that's pretty much the pool of highly skilled, low level accounts.

Is there any more thoughts towards to whole gradual unlock system of runes and masteries? It feels more like each level un-handicaps you a little more, rather than making you feel a little stronger.

Thanks again for being a part of this conversation, it's really encouraging :)

I disagree on this feeling simply because actual first timers don't have a "full runes level 30" feeling. It's like coming off a freeway into city traffic, versus driving out of your house. It's the same speed, but it feels slower off the freeway.

The issue comes in that you can play against players with access to more and better runes and mastery's than yourself, giving them the advantage. The most tangible effect is sub 18, where you will play against people with keystones while you dont have any, which can put you at quite a significant disadvantage, and thats something new players can and DO feel.
